name: Scooped: Spiced Vanilla Ice Cream
description: I have long resented the use of the word "vanilla" to mean bland, blah, and boring. Real vanilla is deep and complex. Anyone who thinks vanilla is boring hasn't tasted this ice cream.
recipeIngredient: 2 vanilla beans, scraped, with pods reserved
1 stick cinnamon, ideally the chinese variety that resembles tree bark
1 tablespoon dark rum, bourbon, or scotch.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the milk, cream, vanilla (pods and seeds), alcohol and spices in a heavy pot, and simmer for 30 minutes.

Ribbon the egg yolks and sugar, and temper into the warm dairy mixture. Cook until it thickened, and it holds a line on a spoon. Pour through a strainer, and chill in the refrigerator at least 4 hours, or overnight.
Spin in your ice cream machine, and enjoy!
